org.locationtech.geowave.core.geotime.store.query.filter.expression.spatial

Interface SpatialExpression

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Expression<FilterGeometry>, Persistable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    SpatialFieldValue, SpatialLiteral, TextToSpatialExpression

    public interface SpatialExpression
extends Expression<FilterGeometry>
    Interface for expressions that resolve to spatial geometry objects.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods

    • Method Detail

      • getCRS

        org.opengis.referencing.crs.CoordinateReferenceSystem getCRS(DataTypeAdapter<?> adapter)
        Get the coordinate reference system for this expression. In cases where a field value geometry is not indexed, the CRS will be derived from the field descriptor of the adapter.
        Parameters:
        adapter - the adapter being filtered
        Returns:
        the coordinate reference system of this expression

      • bbox

        default Predicate bbox(double minX,
                       double minY,
                       double maxX,
                       double maxY)
        Create a predicate that tests this expression against the provided bounding box.
        Parameters:
        minX - the minimum X value
        minY - the minimum Y value
        maxX - the maximum X value
        maxY - the maximum Y value
        Returns:
        the bounding box predicate

      • bbox

        default Predicate bbox(double minX,
                       double minY,
                       double maxX,
                       double maxY,
                       org.opengis.referencing.crs.CoordinateReferenceSystem crs)
        Create a predicate that tests this expression against the provided bounding box in the given coordinate reference system.
        Parameters:
        minX - the minimum X value
        minY - the minimum Y value
        maxX - the maximum X value
        maxY - the maximum Y value
        crs - the coordinate reference system of the bounding box
        Returns:
        the bounding box predicate

      • bboxLoose

        default Predicate bboxLoose(double minX,
                            double minY,
                            double maxX,
                            double maxY)
        Create a predicate that loosely tests this expression against the provided bounding box. This is meant to be a faster implementation for situations where exact accuracy is not needed.
        Parameters:
        minX - the minimum X value
        minY - the minimum Y value
        maxX - the maximum X value
        maxY - the maximum Y value
        Returns:
        the bounding box predicate

      • bboxLoose

        default Predicate bboxLoose(double minX,
                            double minY,
                            double maxX,
                            double maxY,
                            org.opengis.referencing.crs.CoordinateReferenceSystem crs)
        Create a predicate that loosely tests this expression against the provided bounding box in the given coordinate reference system. This is meant to be a faster implementation for situations where exact accuracy is not needed.
        Parameters:
        minX - the minimum X value
        minY - the minimum Y value
        maxX - the maximum X value
        maxY - the maximum Y value
        crs - the coordinate reference system of the bounding box
        Returns:
        the bounding box predicate

      • intersects

        default Predicate intersects(Object other)
        Create a predicate that tests to see if this expression intersects the provided spatial object. The operand can be either another spatial expression, or any object that can be converted to a spatial literal.
        Parameters:
        other - the spatial object to test against
        Returns:
        the intersection predicate
